newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares slide, confidence low.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares slide, confidence low.

text.p: Slovenian shares fell 4.13 percent on Wednesday and market participants said that market optimism had evaporated with the withdrawal of foreign investors.
"If foreign investors return, liquidity will increase and shares could begin climbing again," said Toni Apollonio, an analyst at "A" bank.
The SBI index fell 50.54 points to 1,174.2. Overall 14 shares fell and four rose, while another six were untraded.
Turnover rose to 576.1 million tolars from 304.4 million.
Bank SKB was the most actively traded share, falling 4.10 percent to 38,390 tolars on volume of 8,570 shares for total turnover of 335.3 million tolars.
"Investors are waiting for information about the bank's plans to list its shares in London bourse. If the news is good prices could rise above 40,000 tolars," Apollonio said.
Health resort Terme Catez was the leading decliner, falling 9.75 percent to 10,740 tolars on volume of 2,671 shares for total turnover of 29.2 million tolars.

Food producer droga was the biggest gainer, firming 2.23 percent to to 22,000 tolars on volume of 515 shares for total turnover of 11 million tolars -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
